comments.body: It's not a big deal, but stripping whitespace on lines just adds to the PR noise and possibility of merge conflicts. If you can disable this it's much preferred.

This adds tab-based indentation instead of spaces; later extra space indents are used where I think the indentation was correct. You might review and/or back out whatever superfluous changes in whitespace that you can.
yeah can you use spaces instead?
So this is now an up arrow not down arrow -- just making sure I read the intend of the change correctly
these are indented too much. Also please uses spaces where possible
The special characters seem to have changed here -- is that intended or an accidental change?
@jbonofre wanted to triple-check on this -- is this change intended?
My bad Sean, you are right: it's not intended (resulting upgrade to latest sorttable version). Let me fix that.

Heh, github says this line changed but I don't see it. I'm worried it's a difference in some unprintable character that will throw this off. Any way to make sure this line really didn't change? copy and paste from the previous version or is that what you did?
Let me checkout from master and change just the innerStoreFunction.
